finish.label: The Finish
finish.title: Natural stains
finish.intro: We finish our premium boardgaming tables with a revolutionary plant-based hardwax oil that delivers both exceptional beauty and environmental responsibility.
finish.paragraph1: This eco-conscious finish is 0% VOC [1] and contains no solvents or water, making it one of the cleanest wood treatments available.
finish.paragraph2: Oils penetrate the wood fibers to create outstanding resistance to wear, water, and heat and that is essential protection for gaming tables that endure countless game nights, drink condensation, and the natural oils from players' hands.
finish.paragraph3: Unlike traditional finishes that sit on the surface, this treatment preserves the natural look and feel of the wood, allowing you to experience authentic hardwood warmth while enjoying a finish that's as kind to the environment as it is tough on daily use.
finish.footnoteText: VOC stands for Volatile Organic Compounds—chemicals that evaporate into the air at room temperature and can contribute to indoor air pollution and potential health concerns. Many traditional wood finishes contain high levels of VOCs, which release fumes during application and curing, often requiring extensive ventilation and creating that characteristic "new finish" smell. A 0% VOC finish eliminates these concerns entirely, ensuring better indoor air quality from the moment the piece enters your home, with no toxic fumes, no lingering odors, and no ongoing chemical emissions.

about.title: A Family
about.subtitle: We couldn't find the perfect gaming table. So we designed it ourselves and found master craftsmen who share our obsession with precision.
about.storyP1: It started the way most obsessions do: innocently. A copy of Catan here, a Ticket to Ride there. Before we knew it, our collection had grown to hundreds of games, and our kitchen table was groaning under the weight of Gloomhaven campaigns that stretched across months.
about.storyP2: We're Nikola and Jana, a husband-and-wife team from Serbia with two daughters (Sofija and Nia), three dogs (Billy, Charlie, and Lucy), and a shared love for paragliding and, of course, board games.
about.storyP3: When we couldn't find a gaming table that met our standards—one that was beautiful enough to live in our home, functional enough for serious gaming, and built to last for decades—we decided to design our own.
about.processP1: We didn't outsource the vision. Every aspect of the Arcadian table—the recessed vault depth, the magnetic rail system, the topper weight distribution—came from our own designs, 3D models, and countless prototypes tested during real game nights.
about.processP2: We know what it's like to knock over a drink reaching for dice. We know the frustration of a table that's too small for Twilight Imperium. We know the joy of leaving a game set up for weeks without worry. Every design decision came from lived experience.
about.workshopP1: We designed every detail of the Arcadian table ourselves. But bringing those designs to life required finding craftsmen who share our obsession with precision—a mechanical engineer turned master woodworker who won't tolerate a millimeter of error.
about.workshopP2: The workshop is old-school in the best way: no shortcuts, no compromises, just decades of accumulated knowledge about how wood behaves and how joints should be cut.
about.workshopP3: We value precision above all else, and we found people who feel the same. The result: tables built to last generations.
about.precisionDescription: Every joint is engineered. Every measurement is exact. We won't ship a table that's a millimeter off spec.
about.durabilityDescription: Solid oak, traditional joinery, zero-VOC finishes. Built for the next 50 years of game nights, not the next 5.
about.functionDescription: Designed by gamers, for gamers. Every feature exists because we needed it at our own table.

q1.question: How much does an Arcadian table cost?
q1.answer: The Standard starts at €1,920 and The Grand at €2,390. These are 2026 Q1 batch prices, available until April 30, 2026 or until all 50 batch slots are filled.

q2.question: What sizes are available?
q2.answer: We offer two sizes: The Standard (108×108cm, seats 4) and The Grand (108×189cm, seats 6-8). Both feature a 10cm deep recessed vault for gaming.

q3.question: What wood is the table made from?
q3.answer: Arcadian tables are crafted from solid European oak. We offer two finish options: Arcadian Dawn (natural light oak) and Pan's Shadow (rich walnut tones). A mystery third finish will be revealed exclusively to 2026 batch supporters.

q4.question: How long does assembly take?
q4.answer: About 30 minutes. The table arrives flat-packed with pre-drilled holes and requires only a single tool. No guesswork, no leftover screws.

q5.question: Will it fit through my door?
q5.answer: Yes. Both sizes are designed to fit through standard doorways when flat-packed. Both The Standard and The Grand fit easily.

q6.question: What is the recessed vault?
q6.answer: The vault is a 10cm deep play area beneath the table surface. It keeps game components secure, allows you to leave games set up between sessions, and transforms into a dining table when the toppers are placed on top.

q7.question: How do the toppers work?
q7.answer: The toppers are precision-sized solid oak panels that rest on the table frame, covering the vault. They're heavy enough to stay put during meals but light enough for easy one-hand removal when it's game time.

q8.question: What is the magnetic rail system?
q8.answer: The rail system runs along the inner perimeter of the vault. Accessories like cup holders, dice trays, and component bins snap into place with industrial-strength magnets—no screws required. Position them anywhere along the rail.

q9.question: What finish is used on the wood?
q9.answer: We use a plant-based hardwax oil that's 0% VOC and solvent-free. It penetrates the wood fibers for outstanding resistance to wear, water, and heat while preserving the natural look and feel of the oak.

q10.question: When will my table ship?
q10.answer: The 2026 batch is estimated to ship in Q3 2026. We'll provide regular updates to all supporters throughout the production process.

q11.question: Do you ship internationally?
q11.answer: Yes. We ship across Europe. Shipping costs are calculated at checkout based on your location. Delivery is estimated for Q3 2026.

q12.question: What's included with the table?
q12.answer: Every Arcadian table includes the table frame, legs, topper panels, and assembly hardware. Accessories like cup holders and dice trays are available separately.

q13.question: How durable is the table?
q13.answer: Built to last generations. Solid oak construction, traditional joinery techniques, and a protective hardwax finish ensure your table can handle decades of game nights, family dinners, and daily use.

q14.question: Can I see the table in person?
q14.answer: We occasionally attend board game conventions and events. Follow us on Instagram (@arcadiantables) for announcements about where you can see and experience the Arcadian table.
